document.masterDocTitle: The genus Pholetesor Mason, 1981 (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China, with descriptions of eleven new species

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Mesoscutum with satin-like sheen; phragma freely exposed; scutellar sulcus reduced to a fine groove in which there is no obvious foveolation; female somewhat variable in colour; usually gaster entirely dark, rarely T1, T2 and T3 reddish-yellow; pterostigma yellowish to pale grayish-brown; turned-over part of T1 and basal field (T2+T3) in highly triangle, tending to be highly polished.

Material examined. 1♀ , Cangshan , Dali , Yunnan , 2009.

Distribution. China ( Yunnan , Zhejiang , Sichuan , Shandong ) new record ; Eastern Palaearctic, Europe, Oceanic, Western Palaearctic region.

Note. This species is recorded from China for the first time. It is a variable species especially in colour. Wilkinson (1938) redescribed the species in detail. The only valid characters for recognizing
P . circumscriptus
are the shape of basal field of tergites (2+3) together with the smooth, polished appearance of it and turned-over part of T1 ( Nixon, 1973 ).
